## RAPI vs SPOVI-14

RAPI vs SPOVI-14 Researchers and psychologists often find the need to compare similar items across different questionnaires. One such comparison may be between the Rutgers Alcohol Problem Index (RAPI) and Specific Phobia of Vomiting Inventory (SPOVI-14). The process of harmonisation, or aligning these questionnaires for comparison, can be a lengthy and arduous process. Yet, it is crucial for important cohort and longitudinal studies that can illuminate our understanding of changing social conditions. In this regard, the innovative software, Harmony, provides a solution for efficient and accurate harmonisation of questionnaires like RAPI vs SPOVI-14. Harmony's intuitive capabilities, powered by natural language processing and generative AI models, aid researchers in matching similar questionnaire items. It simplifies the intricate process of comparing items across different languages, making longitudinal analysis across multiple studies both feasible and effective. For a more concrete analysis and comparison of RAPI vs SPOVI-14, Harmony provides a unique and easy-to-use platform. Instead of manually searching through lengthy PDFs, Harmony allows users to directly select instruments from its existing database or upload new ones in PDF format. Upon doing so, AI models provide a detailed percentage match between each item in RAPI and SPOVI-14. Leveraging this, psychologists can gain more nuanced insights into their research, thus making reported results more reliable and useful. If you're a researcher looking to draw more informed conclusions in your study involving RAPI vs SPOVI-14, Harmony can be your utmost tool.

## Compare the items in RAPI and SPOVI-14

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import RAPI and SPOVI-14 into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just RAPI into Harmony</a> - compare RAPI with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SPOVI-14 into Harmony</a> - compare SPOVI-14 with other instruments
